DD_Attribute_Full.name: citation_desc
DD_Attribute_Full.definition:
The CITATION_DESC contains a citation for the product or DATA_SET_INFORMATION object in which it appears. It provides a string that may be used to cite the product (data set) in a publication. It should follow the standard citation order as outlined in Appendix B, Section 31.5.5.3.1 of the PDS Standards reference, which in turn follows established practice for scientific journals that cite electronic publications (e.g., AGU Reference citation format).
The CITATION_DESC must contain sufficient information to locate the product or data set in the PDS archives. For example, the CITATION_DESC in a DATA_SET_INFORMATION object must contain the DATA_SET_ID; it will also likely contain VOLUME_ID information for the archive volumes, an author list, a release date, and so on as appropriate.
Note that if CITATION_DESC is used within any product label within a data set, all product labels within that data set must also have a CITATION_DESC, even if they are only filled with 'N/A'.
DATA_SET Example:
CITATION_DESC = 'Levin, G.V., P.A. Strat, E.A. Guinness, P.G. Valko, J.H. King, and D.R. Williams, VL1/VL2 MARS LCS EXPERIMENT DATA RECORD V1.0, VL1/VL2-M-LCS-2-EDR-V1.0, NASA Planetary Data System, 2000.'
Data Product Example:
CITATION_DESC = 'Cunningham, C., MINOR PLANET INDEX TO SCIENTIFIC PAPERS, EAR-A-5-DDR-BIBLIOGRAPHY-V1.0:REFS-REFS-199409, NASA Planetary Data System, 1994.'

DD_Value_Domain_Full.formation_rule:
In the following descriptions:
angle brackets (<>) indicate information to be supplied by the data preparer braces ({}) indicate optional fields brackets ([]) are literal characters that must be included as shown ellipsis (...) indicates that the preceeding field is repeated as often as necessary punctuation must be used as indicated UPPERCASE_TEXT should be replaced with the value of the keyword contained in uppercase year_of_peer_review is the year that the data set that this file is a part of, officially passed PDS Peer Review text plain text not otherwise mentioned must be included literally
Note that the <year_of_peer_review> should be replaced by the text 'submitted' for data that are in the process of being prepared, reviewed or corrected.
DATA_SET formation ================== { author_name, author_name, ... }. 'data_set_name'. DATA_SET_ID, NASA Planetary Data System, year_of_peer_review.
Product formation ================= { author_name, author_name, ... }. 'product_name'. DATA_SET_ID:PRODUCT_ID, NASA Planetary Data System, year_of_peer_review.
